document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Sharp, D. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Sharp, D. S. (1883) Biologia Centrali-Americana, Insecta, Coleoptera, Staphylinidae. 1 (2), 145 - 312, pls. 5 - 7.

subSubSection.paragraph: 33 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
West Indies: Cuba , Guadeloupe , Saint Vincent & the Grenadines .
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Costa Rica .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Galapagos Isl., Peru , Brazil , Argentina .

bibRefCitation.author: Pace, R.
bibRefCitation.refString: Pace, R. (2008 a) New records of Aleocharinae from Ecuador and Peru, with the description of new species, new subgenera and new genera (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae) In: Giachino, P. M. (Ed.), Biodiversity of South America, I. Memoirs on Biodiversity, 1. World Biodiversity Association Onlus, Verona. pp. 225 - 398.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

Type species:
Placukorna ipsa Santiago-Jiménez in Santiago-Jiménez & Santiago-Navarro, 2016
Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

bibRefCitation.author: Mulsant, E. & Rey, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mulsant, E. & Rey, C. (1871) Histoire Naturelle des Coleopteres de France. Brevipennes. Aleochariens [Huitieme Branche, Bolitocharaires]. Deyrolle Fils, Paris. 321 pp., pls. 1 - 5.

bibRefCitation.author: Erichson, G. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Erichson, G. F. (1837) Die Kafer der Mark Brandenburg. Vol. 1, Part 1. F. H. Morin, Berlin. viii + 384 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 46 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Pace 2008a: 250 (species of Ecuador and Peru ).
West Indies: Saint Vincent & the Grenadines , Guadeloupe .
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Suriname , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
